With less than three weeks until the 2020 General Election, it has never been more important to finalize your voting plan. Rhode Island provides a few options for voting, and we just want to be sure that you know your voting rights.

  • The deadline to apply for a mail ballot has passed, but if you sent in an application, be sure to track the status of your mail ballot at vote.ri.gov.

    You can either drop off your mail ballot in a ballot box at any of these locations, or you can put your ballot back in the mail to return it. Be sure to try to mail your ballot at least a week in advance to accommodate for any mail delays, and track whether it has been received at vote.ri.gov.
  • This year, you can vote early in-person, which is just like going to the polls! You can vote early in-person from now until November 2. For more information on this option, visit the early in-person voting page at vote.ri.gov.
  • If you go to the polls on election day, be sure you know your polling location. While you must have an ID to cast a ballot in-person, you cannot be turned away from voting if you do not have one – instead, the polls must allow you to cast a provisional ballot.

If you have any questions about these processes, contact your local board of canvassers or our office at info@riaclu.org.
